Seems expensive, but I feel that you learn much more and get a better quality education in the small campus environment.

New Orleans is definitely a destination city, so if you're looking to do something for fun, there are plenty of opportunities to find it. The art and history museums are my favorites and you can't forget about Lakeside Mall. There is quite a nightlife downtown on the weekends. No matter what you may choose to do, always make sure you are aware of your surrounding. Stay safe.

New Orleans is really a city full of ethnic diversity with its French, Caribbean, African flair. There is an abundance of soul food, and creole favorites that span from neighborhood corner stores, in to places for fine dining. Manchu's and Cheesecake Bistro tend to be among my favorites. For those that like to stick with the traditional cuisine, no fear for there are plenty of chain restaurants there as well. Maybe takes a chance and try one of the city's most acclaimed Po-boy sandwiches. You won't be disappointed. There is something here for everyone whether you're vegan, kosher, ethnic or looking for something unique.

The dorms get progressively better as you go along your time as a student. First year, if you are living on campus, you will be required to live in a same sex dorm. Second year girls are required to do the same. After that you can live coed or rent houses around the campus if you would like.

Xavier definitely does have a rigorous chemistry program, but that's only because they want to make sure that we are prepared by the time that we graduate. The University stay's true to its mission statement to prepare its students to assume roles of leadership and service in hopes of promoting of a more just and humane society and I find that rather admirable.

Make sure you are ready to work hard and always take advantage of your campus resources. The tutoring centers are very helpful. even if you don't feel that you need it, it is better to be over prepared than lacking.

Xavier University is great school for students looking for a challenging, but fun environment to learn. The small class room professor to student ration work great for those that may have a hard time adjusting to college from high school. Due to the friendliness of professors and locals, there is a homey type of feel to the campus which is nice since you can't get that everywhere.

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Always be ready to work when you come to class Always use planner Utilize the fact the professors are constantly there to help to you Organization is the key to a smooth college life and transition Bang for the buck Xavier is definitely worth the money because you can go to no other school and receive a better education. This is true because you are given the chance to succeed. The school works with you no matter any issue you may. Money is never a problem because if you do the work the school will work with you to keep you in school and try to do as much as they can to help you stay in school. Am enjoying being here Xavier is a very small school so the campus is very intimate. You get the chance to know everyone. Our campus is very active there is usually an event going on no matter what day. The Fraternities and Sororities are very active on the campus and give you multiple opportunities to do volunteer work and just to be involved with the community. We are not the biggest party school but campus life is great. Safety is also a top priority on the campus Am learning a lot
